snippet: Palestinian journalists and activists, imbued with the spirit of the Arab Spring, have become more daring, but the instinct of some in the Palestinian Authority has been to crack down.
abstract: Memo From Ramallah; Palestinian officials, journalists and bloggers struggle to define the principles of freedom of expression and its boundaries, and to distinguish between legitimate criticism and defamation; in recent months, Palestinian Authority has arrested countless journalists and activists for voicing their opinions, in an alleged effort to protect society.
lead_paragraph: Palestinian journalists and activists, imbued with the spirit of the Arab Spring, have become more daring, but the instinct of some in the Palestinian Authority has been to crack down.

headline.seo: Arab Spring Stirs Palestinian Journalists to Test Free Speech Limits
headline.main: Arab Spring Spurs Palestinian Journalists to Test Free Speech Limits
headline.print_headline: Arab Spring Spurs Palestinian Journalists to Test Free Speech Limits
